page.title: 01BOREHAMWOOD-AN INTRODUCTION
page.content: Borehamwood was a small village until the 1950s when there was a rapid expansion to provide housing for families relocated from North London. Separate estates, each with their own parade of shops, were built; and a main shopping street, Shenley Road, also developed around the parish church. Employment centred on the film and television studios, as well as industrial estates whose occupants include Sellotape, GEC and the cold-storage depot of Christian Salvesen. The area also includes specialist concerns such as the Blood Products Laboratory and the Fire Research Station. In the centre of the town are the Civic Offices, the Civic Hall entertainments centre, swimming pool, library, college of further education, and fire, police and ambulance stations.
